alert.note: Alert for Dodge; Mower; Olmsted; Wabasha (Minnesota) Issued by the National Weather Service

info.senderName: NWS LaCrosse (Southwestern Wisconsin, Southeastern Minnesota, and Northeast Iowa)
info.headline: Special Weather Statement issued November 06 at 2:49AM CST by NWS LaCrosse
info.description: ...Elevated Fire Danger this Afternoon... The combination of drier air and strong winds will result in an elevated fire danger this afternoon. Relative humidity values are expected to fall into the 20 to 25 percent range by mid-afternoon, mainly along and west of an Austin to Wabasha line. Winds strengthen this morning and by this afternoon will be from the west at 20 to 25 mph, gusting to 35 to 40 mph. The combination of clouds this morning, lower sun angle, and the rains of the last few days should slow the drying of fuels on the ground and limit their susceptibility. However, grasses may dry quicker and be susceptible for a longer period of time this afternoon. Burning outside today is strongly discouraged and care should be taken if operating outdoor equipment that may produce sparks.
